message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of strategy synthesis in adversarial patrolling games, which involves designing an optimal strategy for a defender to detect possible intrusions at vulnerable targets while the attacker aims to maximize the probability of a successful attack. This problem is related to game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it involves designing optimal strategies. The paper also discusses the complexity of computing such strategies, which falls under computational complexity (cs.CR) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper presents a decomposition method to split a given patrolling problem into smaller subproblems, which is related to systems and control (cs.SY).
